TopicTitle: Prefetching is not allowed due to the various privacy issues that arise (issue with site)

Articles.Content:
Getting very annoying, for example I can't go to page 2 of the addons section because of this issue.

Using google chrome.

Then

A) Don't prefetch.

or

Don't use chrome.
Can you explain how to not pre-fetch? And why don't use chrome?

Can you explain how to not pre-fetch?

http://www.technipages.com/google-chrome-prefetch

I wouldn't bother with prefetch personally, you're increasing your bandwidth usage quite a bit, for the sake of making pages appear to load slightly faster.
I'm somewhat confused as to what the issue here is. I'm using Google Chrome, with prefetching enabled, and I have no issues with navigating the site. Do you have cookies disabled, or something?

http://www.technipages.com/google-chrome-prefetch

I wouldn't bother with prefetch personally, you're increasing your bandwidth usage quite a bit, for the sake of making pages appear to load slightly faster.

Tried that, still getting the prefetching thing. Sigh . Will try with other browsers.

Then

A) Don't prefetch.

or

Don't use chrome.

You know that there will be issues arrising when you say don't you chrome?

You know that there will be issues arrising when you say don't you chrome?

I have to admit that from a pragmatic point of view, that might have been my advice too.

Would you care to elaborate on the issues that arise from not using chrome?

Extreme trader pm me once:

Bad to say this, you'll start flame wars...

like this one

http://lifehacker.com/chrome-vs-fire...nts-1462628969

Fair enough, I can see the desire to avoid a flame-war.

On the other hand, it seems just as irrational to me to avoid suggesting trying an alternative when your preferred method is not achieving the desired result.

Every browser has its strengths. There is no 'one true way'. At the end of the day, this thread is about solving the OP's issue, not tip-toeing around the feelings of people that are looking for reasons to be offended on the internet. (IMHO of course.) In that sense, suggesting the OP try a different browser seems reasonable enough.
